blocks.name: getBusinesses
blocks.description: A list of existing businesses on your eversign account

args.name: type
args.info: Document status. This parameter accepts the following status values: all, my_action_required, waiting_for_others, completed, drafts, cancelled

blocks.name: getSingleDocument
blocks.description: Get an existing document or template

args.name: isDraft
args.info: Set to 1 in order to save this document as a draft. Default: false

args.name: title
args.info: This parameter is used in order to specify a document title. Default: -

args.name: message
args.info: This parameter is used in order to specify a document message. Default: -

args.name: useSignerOrder
args.info: Set to 1 in order to enable Signing Order for this document. Default: false

args.name: reminders
args.info: Set to 1 in order to enable Auto Reminders for this document. Default: false

args.name: requireAllSigners
args.info: Set to 1 in order to require all signers to sign to complete this document. Default: false

args.name: redirect
args.info: This parameter is used to specify a custom completion redirect URL. If empty, the default Post-Sign Completion URL specified in your eversign Business or the eversign signature completion page will be used.

args.name: client
args.info: This parameter is used to specify an internal reference for your application, such as an identification string of the server or client making the API request.

args.name: expires
args.info: This parameter is used to specify a custom expiration date for your document. (Required format: Unix Time Stamp) If empty, the default document expiration period specified in your business settings will be used.

args.name: files
args.info: Document files can be uploaded to your document either by providing a URL, a reference to an existing file ID or through a base64 string. This object can contain multiple sub arrays.

args.name: signers
args.info: This object must contain a sub array for each signer of the document being created. Each sub array requires a unique ID, name and email address.

args.name: recipients
args.info: This object can contain a sub array for each CC of the document to be signed. Name and email

args.name: meta
args.info: This object contains optional key-value data that should be attached to the document. This data will be included when making a GET call for the document created.

args.name: fields
args.info: The fields that should be placed on the document, expressed as a 2-dimensional JSON array. One array of fields is required for each file provided in the files object. If a file has no fields, an empty array must be provided.

args.name: templateId
args.info: Set to the Template ID of the template you would like to use.

args.name: title
args.info: This parameter is used in order to specify a document title.

args.name: message
args.info: This parameter is used in order to specify a document message.

args.name: redirect
args.info: This parameter is used to specify a custom completion redirect URL. If empty, the default Post-Sign Completion URL specified in your eversign Business or the eversign signature completion page will be used.

args.name: client
args.info: This parameter is used to specify an internal reference for your application, such as an identification string of the server or client making the API request.

args.name: expires
args.info: This parameter is used to specify a custom expiration date for your document. (Required format: Unix Time Stamp) If empty, the default document expiration period specified in your business settings will be used.

args.name: signers
args.info: This object must contain a sub array for each signing role of your template.

args.name: recipients
args.info: This object can contain a sub array for each CC of the document to be signed. Name and email

args.name: fields
args.info: This object must contain a sub array for each Merge Field of this template.

blocks.description: Delete document by hash. Only status cancelled or draft

blocks.description: A reminder can be sent on a per-signer basis only.
